body: Brooklyn Hard Courts Q. With the talk of the New Jersey Nets possibly moving to Brooklyn, can you tell me if Brooklyn ever had a pro basketball team? A. title: F.Y.I.

body: CALLAHAN -- Rev. Msgr. Brian F.X., on December 15, 2003. Pastor of St. Thomas Aquinas Church (Flatlands). Beloved son of the late Thomas P. and Frances M. Loving brother of Maj. Thomas P. (USAF, ret.) and Sr. Elaine M. Callahan O.P. and the late Gloria C. Schroeder and William. Also survived by many nieces, nephews, grand nieces and grand nephews.
title: Paid Notice: Deaths CALLAHAN, REV. MSGR. BRIAN F.X.

body: Two men went on an hourlong crime spree in Brooklyn yesterday morning, robbing 12 people at 12 different locations before they were arrested, the police said. They said that the men, Carmine Carini, 22, and Joseph Opperisano, 23, began robbing victims on Pearson Street in Flatlands. An hour later, investigators said, they concluded with a final
title: Metro Briefing | New York: Brooklyn: 2 Held In Robbery Spree

body: This list summarizes our recommendations in some of today's primary election races in New York City and Suffolk County. In some cases the primary is tantamount to election. In others, we may endorse again for the Nov. 4 general election. Polling hours in the metropolitan area are 6 a.m. to 9 p.m. CITY COUNCIL Queens: 27th District (St. Albans,
title: New York Primary Choices

body: Since his election to the City Council two years ago, Kendall Stewart has been widely seen as a quiet legislator who worked without much fanfare or notice to the affairs of his district, which is anchored in the Flatbush section of Brooklyn. But all that changed in June, when Mr. Stewart, a podiatrist-turned-councilman, faced embarrassing news
title: In Brooklyn Race, Three Challengers Take Aim at One Central Issue: The Incumbent

body: Primary elections for New York City Council races will be held Sept. 9. Here are endorsements in two of the most competitive contests in Brooklyn: 34th District (Williamsburg, Bushwick and part of Ridgewood, Queens): A redrawing of the district to include a Queens enclave has residents there worried about being overshadowed by their Brooklyn
title: For City Council in Brooklyn

body: The driver of a commuter van was fatally shot by one of his passengers as the van traveled south through a busy commercial section of Flatbush Avenue in Brooklyn yesterday. The shooting sent people fleeing in panic and led to a series of crashes. The police said the shooting occurred yesterday afternoon in front of 2184 Flatbush Avenue in Flatlands
title: Brooklyn Dollar Van Driver Is Shot to Death by Passenger

body: A Brooklyn woman who was nine months pregnant was found shot dead early yesterday inside her home in Flatlands, the police said. She had been shot once in the head, and was taken to Kings County Hospital. Her baby did not survive. The woman, Lamethia McCollum, 28, of 1394 East 48th Street, lived with her mother and her 9-year-old daughter in an
title: Pregnant Woman, 28, Found Fatally Shot

body: A New York police officer was arrested and charged with selling drugs at a bar in Brooklyn, police officials said. It was not clear when or where the arrest took place, but the officer, Thomas Coyle, was suspended on Sunday. Officer Coyle joined the Police Department in July 1986, an official said. Officers of the department's Internal Affairs
title: Metro Briefing | New York: Brooklyn: Officer Charged With Selling Drugs

author: BARRY ESTABROOK is a writer and editor who lives in Vermont.
body: I TRAVEL for travel's sake,'' Robert Louis Stevenson wrote, an assertion that still has its adherents. But then there are those for whom travel is the means to an end, who pack suitcases and strap on backpacks to pursue a particular passion with a single-minded intensity bordering on fanaticism, one that transcends geographic, political and
title: THEIR PURSUITS COVER LOTS OF GROUND

body: To the Editor: In naming Mickey Ruskin's restaurant establishments, you speak of one named Les Levine's. I believe that while the place was named for the artist, the actual name was Levine's Irish, Jewish, Canadian Cuisine. At least that was the name on the window. The interior had the name in pastel colors on white walls. The swing by Mark di
title: The Mysteries Of Max's

body: A teenager barely old enough to have a driver's license was killed in Brooklyn during an argument over which kind of car would be best to drive, the police said yesterday. On Tuesday night just before 11, a group of about 14 people were sitting outside at East 57th Street and Avenue H in Brooklyn, near the Glenwood Houses in the Flatlands
title: A Fatal Argument Over the Best Cars That Nobody Had

body: One soldier in this division was killed by a sniper's bullet today, as the division consolidated its positions on a broad plateau north of Najaf before what is expected to be a strong assault on Baghdad. After pushing deep into Iraq over three days, the division's units continued to clash with small pockets of Iraqi forces in and around their
title: A NATION AT WAR: WITH THE TROOPS/THIRD DIVISION; G.I.'s Pause on Push to Baghdad, and One Falls to a Sniper
